NPC XML ToDo

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

T
Deprecated

This article is about a feature, subsystem, or proposal that has been deprecated by new developments. Currently its only purpose is as an archive but this page may be removed.
Do not add to this article, instead add to the current version of the article.


NPCs are given their stats and associations through the use of NPC XML. This is currently somewhat sparse, mainly developed in the areas necessary for discussion. Eventually, we hope to replace the current static NPCs with some sort of dynamically generated evolutionary system- at least for animals. Meanwhile, the NPC XML system needs some extensions to allow NPCs to be fully realized within the XML framework. Items to help establish NPCs, as opposed to improve their functionality, can be found at NPC ToDo.

  • Spawn/respawn controlls (if the character dies, when/how does it repopulate?)
  • Self triggers;
    • Ability to change aspects of NPC due to environmental effects- such as time of day, weather, or world events. (example; some guards move to duty position at night while others go to "sleep" locations)
    • Ability to initiate conversation/other actions due to PC actions other than talking to them. (example; shopkeepers who tell PCs not to get into their storerooms.)
  • Ability to change NPC's AI/movement type.
  • Control of the NPC's combat. (who/what/where/how attack- of course this requires combat be fully implemented)
  • Ability to access and modify target's XP (currently access/changes are directly to skill/stat values)
  • Trading/inventory system.
